sgrcolor package#

Module contents#

Color your output with Select Graphic Rendition Code.

Bases: object

Background Colors.

Attributes:

  • RESET

  • (BRIGHT_)BLACK

  • (BRIGHT_)GREEN

  • (BRIGHT_)CYAN

  • (BRIGHT_)WHITE

BLACK = '\x1b[40m'#
BLUE = '\x1b[44m'#
BRIGHT_BLACK = '\x1b[100m'#
BRIGHT_BLUE = '\x1b[104m'#
BRIGHT_CYAN = '\x1b[106m'#
BRIGHT_GREEN = '\x1b[102m'#
BRIGHT_MAGENTA = '\x1b[105m'#
BRIGHT_RED = '\x1b[101m'#
BRIGHT_WHITE = '\x1b[107m'#

RED = '\x1b[41m'#
RESET = '\x1b[49m'#
WHITE = '\x1b[47m'#
YELLOW = '\x1b[43m'#

DIM = '\x1b[2m'#
DOUBLE_UNDERLINE = '\x1b[21m'#
ITALIC = '\x1b[3m'#
NORMAL = '\x1b[22m'#
STRIKE = '\x1b[9m'#
UNDERLINE = '\x1b[4m'#
class sgrcolor.Reset#

Bases: object

Reset Style or color.

Attributes:

  • ALL

  • FG (Also available as FG.RESET)

  • BG (Also available as BG.RESET)

ALL = '\x1b[0m'#
BG = '\x1b[49m'#
FG = '\x1b[39m'#
class sgrcolor.SGRColor(font: Literal['BOLD', 'DIM', 'ITALIC', 'UNDERLINE', 'STRIKE', 'NORMAL', 'DOUBLE_UNDERLINE'] | tuple[Literal['BOLD', 'DIM', 'ITALIC', 'UNDERLINE', 'STRIKE', 'NORMAL', 'DOUBLE_UNDERLINE'], ...] | None = None, fg: Literal['BLACK', 'RED', 'GREEN', 'YELLOW', 'BLUE', 'MAGENTA', 'CYAN', 'WHITE', 'BRIGHT_BLACK', 'BRIGHT_RED', 'BRIGHT_GREEN', 'BRIGHT_YELLOW', 'BRIGHT_BLUE', 'BRIGHT_MAGENTA', 'BRIGHT_CYAN', 'BRIGHT_WHITE'] | None = None, bg: Literal['BLACK', 'RED', 'GREEN', 'YELLOW', 'BLUE', 'MAGENTA', 'CYAN', 'WHITE', 'BRIGHT_BLACK', 'BRIGHT_RED', 'BRIGHT_GREEN', 'BRIGHT_YELLOW', 'BRIGHT_BLUE', 'BRIGHT_MAGENTA', 'BRIGHT_CYAN', 'BRIGHT_WHITE'] | None = None)#

Bases: object

Generate an object to format input string.

Usage:

>>> important = SGRColor(
        font=('BOLD', 'ITALIC'),
        fg='YELLOW',
    )
>>> print(important('Something IMPORTANT.'))

Constructor method.

FontStyles:

  • BOLD

  • DIM

  • ITALIC

  • UNDERLINE

  • STRIKE

  • NORMAL

  • DOUBLE_UNDERLINE

Colors:

  • BLACK

  • RED

  • GREEN

  • YELLOW

  • BLUE

  • MAGENTA

  • CYAN

  • WHITE

  • BRIGHT_BLACK

  • BRIGHT_RED

  • BRIGHT_GREEN

  • BRIGHT_YELLOW

  • BRIGHT_BLUE

  • BRIGHT_MAGENTA

  • BRIGHT_CYAN

  • BRIGHT_WHITE

Parameters:

  • font (FontStyles|tuple[FontStyles, ...]|None) – String or Tuple of the font to use.

  • fg (Colors) – String of the foreground color to use.

  • bg (Colors) – String of the background color to use.

__call__(text: str) → str#

Return colored text.

Parameters:

text (str) – The text to be colored.

Returns:

Colored text.

Return type:

str

Submodules#

sgrcolor.types module#
